qas.question: What is the name of the big game hunting foundation in Montana?
What season is black bear hunting allowed?
What two predators can be hunted in specific numbers?

context: Montana is home to the <a0_0>Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation<a0_0/> and has a historic big game hunting tradition. There are fall bow and general hunting seasons for elk, pronghorn antelope, whitetail deer and mule deer. A random draw grants a limited number of permits for moose, mountain goats and bighorn sheep. There is a <a1_0>spring<a1_0/> hunting season for black bear and in most years, limited hunting of bison that leave Yellowstone National Park is allowed. Current law allows both hunting and trapping of a specific number of <a2_0>wolves and mountain lions<a2_0/>. Trapping of assorted fur bearing animals is allowed in certain seasons and many opportunities exist for migratory waterfowl and upland bird hunting.
